document_data.caption: Swordcrag on the map of [[Tarkhaldale]].
document_data.name: Swordcrag
document_data.mainbody: '''Swordcrag''' was an [[Orc|orcish]] fort in the [[Tarkhaldale]], the Lost Dale.
document_data.Description: The tall grey rocky crag, which had given the name to the village, stood as a marker, visible for miles.
document_data.Geography: Swordcrag stood tucked away in the south-western part of the [[Desertsmouth Mountains]]' foothills.
document_data.Society: By [[1367 DR]], among Swordcrag's residents were only the members of the remaining [[orc]] tribe and [[Ogre|ogrish]] guards of the [[Durang Head-taker|local chieftain]].
document_data.History:
Swordcrag was once a small mining [[village]] which was built before the {{YearlinkName|-88}}.

The village was conquered during an invasion of the orcs of the [[Dragonspine Mountains]], which had overrun the whole Tarkhaldale by {{YearlinkName|-87}}. Since then the orcs controlled the mines below the imposing crag.

By 1367 DR the remaining orcs and ogres living in Swordcrag had fought in several conflicts against the [[Saurial|saurials]] from [[Tarkhaldan]]. The orc chieftain of Swordcrag, [[Durang Head-taker]] with help of his shaman, [[Yegg Blackteeth]], spent years forging alliances among neighboring tribes to challenge the saurials and was successful at it.
document_data.Notable inhabitants:
*[[Durang Head-taker]], an orc chieftain of Swordcrag.
*[[Yegg Blackteeth]], an orc shaman of Swordcrag.
